get.summary: The details of a payment made in an app using Facebook Payments
get.description: The details of a payment made in an app using Facebook Payments

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: The list of different action types that have occurred in this payment.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The app associated with this payment

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Buyer's ISO Country Code, for tax purposes.

parameters.name: created_time
parameters.description: The time the payment was originally created.

parameters.name: disputes
parameters.description: Contains the information related to a dispute,  including the user_comment and user_email which is provided by the consumer when the dispute is initiated. Additionally contains the current status of the dispute, the time the dispute was created an an resolution reason, if available.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: The items associated with the payment.

parameters.name: payout_foreign_exchange_rate
parameters.description: Exchange rate used to calculate payout amount which is remitted in USD.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The URL of the og:product object ordered

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The quantity of the product contained in the order

parameters.name: request_id
parameters.description: The unique, optional app-created identifier passed into the JS function (255 character maximum)

parameters.name: tax
parameters.description: The tax parameter specifies if a payment is subject to VAT and, if so, how the tax was paid. This can take on the following values:not_taxed: There's no VAT on this payment because it came from outside the European Union.  already_paid: The tax on this payment has already been paid by the user's mobile carrier or other upstream partytax_remitted: Facebook paid the VAT on this payment on your behalf. The tax amount will be deducted from your payout.See here for more information.

parameters.name: tax_country
parameters.description: The country determined by Facebook for tax calculation of this purchase, given as an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Note: This field is for your information only and it should not be used for any recalculation or reconciliation purposes. If tax is equal to not_taxed or already_paid this field will be omitted.

parameters.name: test
parameters.description: Optional parameter that shows up when a payment is made by a payment tester listed in the app's dashboard. This represents a transaction that has not been charged to the consumer's payment instrument

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The consumer's first and last name along with their user id. May be omitted in some cases.

post.summary: Used to settle any payment disputes
post.description: Used to settle any payment disputes

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason you are settling this dispute. This is required.

post.summary: Used to issue any payment refunds
post.description: Used to issue any payment refunds

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to refund. This is required. It must be less than or equal to the refundable_amount field on the parent Payment object.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The three-letter ISO code of the currency in which the refund amount is specified; it must be the same as the currency in which the original purchase was denominated. This is required.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason you are refunding this order.
